citeinfo.origin:
Census of Marine Life
Vancouver Aquarium
citeinfo.title: Pacific Ocean Shelf Tracking (POST) Project Database

abstract.p: The Pacific Ocean Shelf Tracking (POST) project database provides web-based access to data collected through the project. It contains three areas of information:

Researchers can download http://www.meds-sdmm.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/post/databaseInit.do?req=down available data or view products http://www.meds-sdmm.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/post/databaseInit.do?req=product based on uploaded data. Password access is required for the most recent data.

purpose.p: The Pacific Ocean Shelf Tracking (POST) project aims to build an acoustic tracking array along the west coast of North America. The early applications focused on tracking the migration, life span, movement and behavior of Pacific salmon. The project is expanding to encompass other species such as rockfish, sturgeon and small pelagics.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
